title: Broadcast Partnership Announced with Major Network
author: David Wilson
excerpt: A major television broadcast partnership has been announced, bringing live coverage of the Wakefield 300 to audiences across Australia and New Zealand.
body: A groundbreaking television broadcast partnership has been announced that will bring comprehensive live coverage of the Wakefield 300 to audiences across Australia and New Zealand. The multi-year deal represents the largest media commitment in the event's history.

The broadcast package will include live coverage of qualifying sessions, support races, and the main 300-kilometer endurance event. Professional commentary teams and on-board cameras will provide viewers with unprecedented access to the action.

"This partnership marks a new chapter for the Wakefield 300," commented Media Director Rachel Green. "Having our event broadcast to a national audience will help showcase the incredible talent and competition that makes this race so special."

The coverage will feature state-of-the-art production values, including helicopter footage, multiple camera angles, and in-depth driver interviews. Online streaming options will also be available for international viewers and those preferring digital platforms.

Pre-race programming will begin two hours before the main event, featuring driver profiles, technical analysis, and behind-the-scenes content. Post-race coverage will include podium ceremonies and comprehensive race analysis.
